programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les argue over an important decision, while a scientist turns up in the shop claiming his vintage device can cure diseases.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: Tension flares up quickly in the wildfire round, while the chefs must take the crossfire round with a grain of salt and the final is all about celebrating the Cape.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: With previous dives ending in failure, Martin's son Grant offers up an alternative strategy to recover the treasure of the Republic.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The hunters adopt some unusual tactics to recover from a run of bad luck, and one team goes in search of a rogue gator that has been preying on farmers' livestock.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: New employees Phil and Wayne face big problems, Al runs into trouble on a steep and twisting road, while Jamie and Adam race to re-open two highways.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Customers offer the team some spooky artefacts during Halloween, including a 19th-century vampire-killing kit and a set of equipment used in paranormal investigations.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team tries to get a good price on a fighter jet, as well as a baseball bat and glove signed by acclaimed player Babe Ruth.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigation into a possible alien visitation to England in December 1980, when Air Force personnel claimed they saw strange lights hovering in the sky.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The conspiracy theories surrounding a UFO sighting in Mexico in 1974. It was reported the object was lost over Coyame, but shortly afterwards a civilian plane crashed nearby.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After forging a signature blade from the steel rings of a whiskey barrel, the finalists create an instrument of Chinese warfare - the Qinglong Ji.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: Three executive chefs compete in this barbecue competition, showing their skills with the grill over three rounds.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.sub-title: That's the Way the Chicharron Crumbles
programme.desc: Culinary competition, and while signature dish round showcases some barbecue heavyweights. the crossfire and feast of fire rounds serve up some nostalgic classics.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman rejects custom-made earrings, as she thought the term diamond cut meant they were diamonds. Seth puts his faith into younger sellers, believing they can outperform Les.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee accidentally cracks the screen of a plasma-screen television. A customer becomes irate when the pneumatic hammer he is trying to sell does not work.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man sells Seth some Detroit Red Wings memorabilia, but Les feels that the money offered was too much and some of the items he purchased are just for him and not for resale.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les question Ashley's skills of diplomacy after observing her interact with several customers.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley compete to sell the most goods, with the loser having to pay a forfeit. A musician with limited funds seeks a new bass to replace the one he has broken.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les argue over an important decision, while a scientist turns up in the shop claiming his vintage device can cure diseases.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A couple try to exchange a pair of earrings for a promise ring, but Les declares the stones purchased for $1,000 as fake.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth intervenes in a confrontation between a customer and an employee in the car park, and is later given a 30th birthday surprise by his colleagues.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Items appraised include an antique electrotherapy kit, a 19th-century revolving cannon, a jukebox from 1973 and a 50-year-old electric waffle iron.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a piece of marble from Abraham Lincoln's tomb, an African sword and an antique Charlie Chaplin doll, but are not sure if the sellers are trustworthy.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and the Old Man examine a pipe belonging to President Ulysses S Grant and a shoe from the famous racehorse Secretariat.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a hat belonging to a member of Lynyrd Skynyrd and a sports car.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The experts appraise a collection of vintage toy cars, a pair of First World War German Pickelhaube helmets and a necklace once owned by Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The experts appraise a 1958 Glastron Seaflight boat, a copy of Dracula signed by author Bram Stoker, and a collection of antique billiard items.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee investigates a pirate ship parade float, and the boys are given a chance to cast their eyes over a collection of 17 one ounce silver art bars from the early 1970s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chumlee are offered a Bugs Bunny poster signed by voice artist Mel Blanc, and also consider buying a golf club once owned by Dean Martin.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The heat is on for Bodie as he faces the biggest restoration project of his career.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: As science turns towards augmenting humanity with technology, theorists suggest that society is merely following the path of its alien creators.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient astronaut theorists look at the Aborigine legend of Dreamtime, and ask if these stories hold the proof that aliens created life on Earth.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: Martin Bayerle makes one more attempt to recover the sunken treasure of The Republic.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: King Philip launches a massive attack on the Chartres Temple, igniting a battle that will determine the fate of the Knights Templar. Tom Cullen, Ed Stoppard, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney star.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A vampire alligator terrorises Troy's hunting grounds, while RJ hunts with his brother Al for the first time since they were teenagers.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Extended edition. Comedian, writer and actress Katherine Ryan guest hosts the satirical quiz, with stand-up Joe Wilkinson and broadcaster and writer Gyles Brandreth joining regular team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites boxer Nicola Adams, comedian Frankie Boyle and comedy actress Diane Morgan to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include magicians, losing one's keys and life itself.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Gina Yashere, Lost Voice Guy, Ed Gamble
programme.desc: Gina Yashere comperes the comedy show at London's Hammersmith Apollo. She warms up the audience before introducing routines by 2018 Britain's Got Talent winner Lost Voice Guy and Mock the Week regular Ed Gamble.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: Bob Mortimer spins this dark, witty yarn about a jobbing actor who makes a smash-hit advert for tea in a former Soviet state.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Gendle and Tim are dropped into a downhill bike park and create a human marble run using motorbikes and riders wearing zorbs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Matt LeBlanc and Chris Harris go to Norway to test drive the latest estate cars from Porsche and Ferrari, while Rory Reid is joined by racing driver Sabine Schmitz for an unusual motoring challenge - to create Britain's newest mountain with the help of a tiny Suzuki. The team is joined in the studio by Westworld star James Marsden.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef journeys along the Etang de Thau, famous for its oysters and mussels, before mooring his barge in the port of Sete, where Bastille Day is being celebrated. He also rustles up seafood ragout and roast black bream before travelling on to Marseille to tackle the most famous fish dish of all - bouillabaisse.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's epic journey from the Atlantic to the Mediterranean comes to an end as he takes the final leg of his gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France. Arriving in Marseille, he samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as showing a variety of traditional recipes. He also cooks roast black bream and finds time to send Chalky a postcard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit a museum in Louisiana dedicated to Bonnie and Clyde, and examine a roadie's collection of valuable rock memorabilia.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys find a replica spaceship during a picking trip in Louisiana, and Mike employs some new negotiating tactics to get a suitable price.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: A monster scares the bidders, while Brandon and Lori bet big on a DJ's equipment.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The bargain hunters head to an airport auction and compete for luggage and plane parts.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Jesse are forced to team up and help each other to gamble on a once-in-a-lifetime locker.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are torn between what could be a massive haul courtesy of a studio props supplier, and an auction across town.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A refugee from war-torn Venezuela tells officers how she paid human traffickers to smuggle her through Central America and to the Mexico-United States border. In Laredo, an American couple caught smuggling methamphetamine inside cans of vegetables crumble while being questioned and give officers information about a chain of so-called 'stash houses' where drugs and illegal immigrants are being kept.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall, winner of the 2017 World's Strongest Man contest, tours the USA on a quest to conquer the biggest and best eye-watering food and physical challenges. Eddie lands in Florida Keys to attempt a conch-fritter eating record, do some serious big-game fishing and try what's billed as the best Key Lime Pie on earth.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall squares up to the Mac & Cheese Challenge at Brooklyn's Mac Shack - which weighs in at more than two kilograms and nearly 7,000 calories of pasta, cheese and sauce.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to the countryside where they harness a group of hi-tech tractors and try to cultivate their own source of fuel. Meanwhile, the Lamborghini Murcielago LP640 is put through its paces, and actress Kristin Scott Thomas is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May build their own stretch limousines out of other vehicles and use them to transport celebrities to the Brit Awards. Meanwhile, a Ford Mustang is put through its paces, and actress Billie Piper is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites boxer Nicola Adams, comedian Frankie Boyle and comedy actress Diane Morgan to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include magicians, losing one's keys and life itself.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Grumpy comic Jack Dee, footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker and actress Fay Ripley reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include white-van drivers, competitive parents and people who tell the truth.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Outdoor survival expert Ray Mears, TV presenter Fiona Bruce and comedienne Katherine Ryan tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include caravans, cushions on beds and Cheryl.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack's not having much luck with lights these days, whether it's the fizzling sign at the start of this show, the blackout during his recent Sheffield gig, or the dimly lit area at the start of this seventh series. Lee and Lucy have enjoyed a spot of culture at their local cinema, but the sparkle of a French movie is soon diminished when the romantic walk home finds them in an imposing underpass. She has her handbag stolen by a bunch of cocky youths from under his nose. Given the fact the layabout failed to protect her, or come up with an accurate description of their muggers, Lee feels the urge to prove his manliness, but will a spell at the local boxing ring be a help or a hindrance? Sally Bretton and Katy Wix also star.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A wealthy new couple move into the block and soon find out that sharing a building with Lee and Lucy is anything but straightforward. The fun begins when Lee somehow manages to bag an invitation to a christening party being thrown by the couple - sending him and Lucy on a last-minute gift-buying trip, during which they make every wrong decision humanly possible to find the perfect present for the baby who seems to have everything. Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden join the cast, with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy decides she wants to have a baby, but what she didn't expect was for the whole family to take a personal interest in the conception. Lee thinks he should be the one, of course - so he can't believe it when she reveals she is planning to have the child with another man. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star, with Katy Wix, Bobby Ball, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Gary Delaney and Zoe Lyons join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz from July 2012.

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats
programme.desc: Big Zuu is going regal as he heads to Royal Leamington Spa to meet and eat with comedian and actor Guz Khan. Leamington was once a place Queen Victoria visited, now it's the mandems turn.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Milton Jones and Ava Vidal join Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for the comedy panel show taking aim at the week's news from July 2012.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Conservative MP Johnny Mercer and comedian Zoe Lyons joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.

programme.title: Coast
programme.sub-title: Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
programme.desc: Neil Oliver leads the team to Cornwall and discovers the network of communication cables under Porthcurno beach. Miranda Krestovnikoff discovers how a shipwreck can be turned into a natural wildlife sanctuary, and Mark Horton visits the Isles of Scilly - known to some archaeologists as the Isles of the Dead.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels from Dublin to Derry. On the way, Miranda Krestovnikoff visits the only beach race in Europe run under Jockey Club rules at Laytown Races and Alice Roberts finds herself sent to the Irish salt mines. Mark Horton investigates a lost year in the life of the world's first ocean liner, while Neil Oliver meets the Londonderry women who secretly witnessed the surrender of German U-Boats at the end of the Second World War.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The changing landscape of the coastline from Newcastle to Hull. Neil Oliver explores the ancient coastal home of the Venerable Bede, and goes to Bridlington to learn about the 200-year struggle to design an unsinkable lifeboat. Mark Horton discovers how laser technology could predict coastal erosion, Dick Strawbridge finds out how Middlesbrough's Transporter Bridge put the city on the map, and Miranda Krestovnikoff heads to Bempton Cliffs.

programme.title: Secrets of the Third Reich
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Third Reich: The Nazi Gold Train
programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for a missing train containing Nazi treasure, which was believed to have been hidden in the mountains of Poland.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The crew visits Germany to collect a multi-million-pound maintenance machine so large it will need to be loaded onto two trucks. Eric and Chris oversee a diesel-engine exchange.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave gets a nasty surprise when he opens the bonnet of a fast Ford from the 80's, and an Austin Heavy 12 nearly a century old sets off a bidding war at the auction.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe narrates the first of three special editions of the archive music show focusing on 1960s hits, beginning with tracks by artists including the Foundations, Julie Driscoll, Sandie Shaw and Procol Harum.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Another selection of performances from the archives, focusing on hits of the 1960s. Featured artists include Clodagh Rodgers, the Move, Tom Jones and the Bee Gees, plus more from Top of the Pops and other shows from the era. Narrated by Mark Radcliffe.

programme.title: The Rolling Stones at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the band's performances from the BBC archives, in a programme originally broadcast in 2012 to celebrate their 50th anniversary. Songs include The Last Time, Let's Spend The Night Together, Get Off of My Cloud, Honky Tonk Women, Gimme Shelter, Miss You and Start Me Up. Plus, footage of the band performing 19th Nervous Breakdown on Top of the Pops in 1966, which was used in a 1960s BBC documentary about women with depression.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Exploring the history of Westminster Abbey, which dates back to the 11th century and houses more than 500 corpses, including those of Edward I, Elizabeth I, Charles Darwin and Isaac Newton, as well as staging 16 royal weddings. The episode also explores the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the somewhat macabre history of Scotland Yard, and revealing the lesser-known facts about one of the world's most famous police stations.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: In 1925 the SS Cotopaxi carrying coal and 32 men vanished. It has since become synonymous with one of the ocean's greatest mysteries - the Bermuda Triangle.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Tower of London
programme.desc: An exploration of British landmarks, beginning with a look at the Tower of London - which has served as a castle, a jail and a place of execution.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is called in to investigate the murders of a ruthless businessman and his family, but still finds time for romance with an old flame. Meanwhile, a preoccupied Leo unwittingly puts his reputation on the line by dismissing a junior pathologist's doubts concerning the seemingly routine death of an elderly woman. Feature-length episode, starring Amanda Burton and Tom Ward.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuthing housewife investigates a spiritualist who appears to be blackmailing her customers, while Geoffrey falls in love, but his secret romance threatens to undermine Hetty's carefully laid trap - and nearly causes him to quit the agency.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Leela investigates a 'happy slapping' incident. Tracing the teenage culprits to a nearby school, she finds they show no remorse. Amber, Ramani and Zain look into a case of domestic violence, only to find the circumstances aren't as clear-cut as they initially appeared. Back at the station, Dan Casper is teased about his seemingly non-existent love life, and Adam tries to quell gossip about the bogus Gabriel Kent's fatal fall.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Peggy is aghast to learn Stephen has been indulging in extracurricular activities with one of his teachers, and orders her to break off the affair or get out of town. Drama, starring Pam Ferris, Sarah Lancashire and Tony Haygarth.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Vic Snow makes a new friend, while Ruth's baby son Alfie is snatched by one of the residents at a local nursing home and taken on a bizarre trek over freezing-cold Skelthwaite Moors - in the general direction of the local reservoir. Popular drama, starring Sarah Lancashire, Pam Ferris, Tony Haygarth and Thomas Craig.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer attempts to sell dodgy prints to a friend of Lady Jane Felsham - only to learn Eric has procured a bronze statue in a house on a pig farm famously stolen from Her Majesty the Queen. Drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Who Is the Fairest of Them All?
programme.desc: The antiques dealer is asked to sell a sinister-looking mirror from a ballet school, and determines to finally marry Lady Jane. However, the object of his affections has some shocking news for him that suggests he may have left matters too late. Roger Lloyd Pack (Trigger in Only Fools and Horses) guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Richard Sharpe and the faithful Harper begin their latest tour of duty by uncovering top-level corruption in the Army. Reporting their findings leads to attempts on their lives, so they fake their own deaths and re-enlist under new identities in an attempt to expose the culprits. Guest starring Julian Fellowes and featuring Alexander Armstrong in an early role.

credits.actor: featuring Alexander Armstrong in an early role

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Dennis's first task as gaffer is to pick up a valuable antique bath from Fidel Castro's country residence and bring it back to Havana as a gift to the ambassador. Despite having made other plans for their day off, the lads reluctantly agree to join him, and a bite to eat at the Cuban leader's expense helps to lift their spirits - but Barry, Oz and Neville disappear en route. Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A besotted Oz persuades the gang to do a spot of moonlighting by helping renovate Ofelia's rundown home. Wyman takes a leaf out of his late father's book by seducing embassy worker Tina. Meanwhile, Neville's loyalties are tested when he is ordered to spy on a Manchester United fan, and Dennis begins to feel left out. Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Kevin Whately star.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to create a garden as a wedding present, and find a baby under a gooseberry bush. The discovery brings out Rosemary's maternal side as the pair investigate who abandoned the child. Their task is complicated by the murder of an artistic neighbour - and the two mysterious incidents appear to be connected. Starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo visit a resort in Spain to create a trophy garden for a pro-am tennis tournament run by a former champion. When one of the competitors is found dead, everyone assumes it to be a gruesome accident - but there is more to the case than meets the eye. While investigating, Laura enters the mysterious world of bullfighting, and Rosemary rediscovers her love of motor scooters.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered amateur detectives work on a garden for an open-air theatre, where Rosemary's cousin is due to perform. However, the production suffers a setback when an actor shoots himself during rehearsal - and the gun is found to have contained live bullets instead of blanks. A member of the cast gets an attack of stage fright, and Laura is obliged to take her place in the play as the duo try to find the culprit. Drama, with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: An avid cyclist suffers a massive coronary at the top of a local mountain, but with astronomical levels of caffeine in his system, there is more to his death than meets the eye.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Sid falls for the heiress to a local brewery, only for her to be arrested for the murder of her own father. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: After three months back in 2010, Alex is desperate to return to the 1980s, where Gene is on the run accused of trying to kill her, and the team is in disarray with Ray promoted to DI and a child's kidnapping to investigate. As the past merges into the present, she is visited by the ghost of a dead policeman and realises there are still dark secrets to unearth. Drama, starring Keeley Hawes and Philip Glenister.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A serial killer targets women signed up to a dating agency, so Alex puts aside her examination of Sam Tyler's death back in Manchester to go undercover. However, as it becomes clear that Shaz matches the profile of previous victims, she steps forward to snare the murderer - an act set to be her last as a police officer. Fantasy crime drama, starring Keeley Hawes and Monserrat Lombard, with Beth Goddard.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. He finds one when a chance remark leads the team to reopen an investigation into the death of a heroin user nine years previously - and to help reveal the truth, Gerry is sent undercover as a sex addict. Richard Wilson and Fay Ripley guest star.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News @ Breakfast
programme.desc: Join Stephen Dixon and Gillian Joseph for all the news from home and abroad, the latest sport and weather, and a review of the weekend papers.

programme.title: Sky News @ Breakfast

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies (2014)
programme.desc: Dwarf king Thorin reclaims control of his homeland, but his descent into madness places him on the brink of war with his human and elven allies. As Thorin's Hobbit friend Bilbo tries to save the tormented ruler from himself, a vast horde of orcs gathers to destroy them all. Conclusion of the fantasy adventure trilogy, starring Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage, Ian McKellen, Luke Evans and Orlando Bloom.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that Fizz is a hat he is going to wear for his romantic date with Marnie. That's bad enough, but Fizz has a very important job to do!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: At the supermarket, Magoo mixes his shopping cart up with a baby stroller. Fizz decides to save the toddler and become a media star..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks Weasel has opened a restaurant, and wants to help him improve it. He mistakes the FizzLab for a kitchen!.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The Mikkelsens have pizza and the raccoons will do anything to get it. Can Mike hold them off for long enough for his owners to enjoy their dinner?.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The raccoons break into the Mikkelsens' and Mercury stumbles upon a didgeridoo and just can't get enough of it. Can Mike shut them up?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean looks back over his life, recalling how he acquired his beloved teddy bear and learned to drive. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A mysterious furry pink animal moves in with Bean, who doesn't know what it is but can't bring himself to get rid of such an odd creature.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Get ready for awesome action adventures with Rath! Taking out villains is all part of the fun for this hero. His mission - to save the day!.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Sickening Fumes of Smartsy Fartsy
programme.desc: The boys create a smart gas cloud to steal Mr Krupp's rulebook, but it turns against them..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Betty wants a nice photo of Dave and Anna, but the camera George uses happens to belong to Gran, and it's been cursed by an ancient mummy..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: If there were two things Dave could wish for it would be for Fuzzypeg to smell better, and for Gran to be nicer. Is getting what you want always a good thing?.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James presents more highlights from the series, as well as preparing prawn biryani, French onion soup, and fig gateau, and providing a masterclass on steamed sponge pudding. Plus, James' culinary tour of Cornwall and recipes from chefs Clare Smyth, Atul Kochhar and Richard Bertinet.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Clare Smyth for a tour of the Lake District. They visit the Windermere Jetty Museum and take a trip on the lake in a traditional steam-powered boat. They also visit the farmers who supply the meat for Clare's restaurant and discover the secrets behind the region's famous sticky toffee pudding.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is still in the eastern Mediterranean country of Jordan. In the seaside city of Aqaba he uses local molasses in a fattoush salad, and cooks with the chefs at a swanky golf club, where roasted fish with spicy rice is the order of the day. Ainsley also visits the city of Petra, learning the history of the Bedouin people and exploring the astonishing Treasury building. Back in his kitchen, chicken shawarma with tahini sauce and pitta bread packed with spiced beef mince are the final dishes on the menu.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his team are in Doncaster, where Stewart Hofgartner assesses a vintage camera and Fay Rutter hopes to pocket a handsome timepiece.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five university friends answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 2018 World Cup: England v Colombia - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces a look back at the memorable last-16 tie at Otkritie Arena, Moscow, which was decided by a penalty shootout. Original coverage presented by Mark Pougatch, with analysis from Ian Wright, Lee Dixon and Gary Neville, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Glenn Hoddle.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara host the grand final of the obstacle course challenge, with the final five competitors from across the nation testing their strength, speed and courage. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian takes a trip down memory lane as he presents a series of classic TV game shows, which have all been updated with a new final round offering the contestants a chance to win big. The next four weeks will see Alan in charge of The Price Is Right, Take Your Pick, Strike it Lucky and Bullseye. But tonight he steps into the shoes of much-missed funnyman Bruce Forsyth for Play Your Cards Right, which sees four celebrity couples taking a chance on the turn of a single card. The hopefuls are daytime stalwarts Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes, comedian Chris Ramsey and his wife Rosie, presenter Ore Oduba and his wife Portia, and singer-actress Martine McCutcheon and her husband Jack McManus.

programme.title: Captain America: Civil War (2016)
programme.desc: The superhuman soldier is propelled into conflict with his Avengers teammate Iron Man over a system of government control over their actions - a situation made worse when an old friend is accused of being behind a terror attack. As a cunning conspiracy surrounds them all, Captain America finds himself battling former allies, vengeful enemies, and new heroes on the block Black Panther and Spider-Man. Superhero adventure, starring Chris Evans, Robert Downey Jr and Scarlett Johansson.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. After buying a Mini City 1000 for 700, Mike Brewer plans to showcase the car at the three-day 50th birthday celebration of the vehicle in Birmingham. The only problem is that mechanic Edd China still has to complete the work necessary to restore it to its former glory.

programme.title: Explosions Gone Wrong
programme.desc: Experts examine the science behind big blasts and suggest how they can be prevented. Featuring footage of exploding buildings, roads, trains and other vehicles.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mikey Teutul leaves the show and Paul Jr confronts his father in an explosive meeting, while OCC finishes the Italian sports car bike and PJD unveils the Skil bike.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: The development of British bombers, including the Lancaster, the Wellington and the Blenheim.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe travels to Arizona and tries his hand at moving a giant cactus. He then he heads to Idaho to work with millions of maggots.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew travels to the birthplace of the McLaren 650S, to reveal its inner workings and admire its attractive exterior.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew heads to Michigan to construct a profile of the Falcon F7 supercar.

programme.title: Steel Buddies
programme.desc: The team members move a Centurion tank for a British expat, but get more adventure than they bargain for when test driving an M2 alligator amphibious vehicle on the Rhine.

programme.title: Devonport: Inside the Royal Navy
programme.desc: The breakwater is damaged during stormy weather, and rough seas may scupper plans to make repairs. Plus, a battle erupts between Devonport's two beekeeping teams.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China embark on a project to restore a classic 1.8-litre VW Mark 1 Golf GTi.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China continue their project to get a 1.8-litre VW Mark 1 Golf GTi in prime condition to go back out on the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys an old Lancia Delta Integrale, enlisting Edd China to fix the brakes and change the battery.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China completes his work on the Lancia Delta Integrale, and Mike Brewer has no trouble in finding an eager buyer for the newly restored classic car.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer purchases a Toyota MR2 in need of Edd China's expertise, and the mechanic soon gets to work overhauling the car's bodywork.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues working on the Toyota MR2, while Mike Brewer heads to a specialist company to get some refurbished wheels.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to buy a Ford Sierra Cosworth on a budget of only 5,000, before handing it over to mechanic Edd China for extensive renovation work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer bags a bargain example of one of his dream cars - a Ford Fiesta XR2 - but there is only 1,000 to spend on repairs.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China take on their first Honda, but finding a cheap S2000 is hard and Mike gambles on a car that has already had more than 4,000 spent on it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Mazda coupe that appears to have nothing wrong with it, so he decides to give expert mechanic Edd China the task of making a good car even better.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a budget Nissan Skyline supercar and Edd China sets about transforming it into a home-made drift racer.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: In an unassuming corner of Wales lies one of the world's busiest yards for aircraft end-of-life services - home to dozens of these retired relics of the sky. With exclusive access to the day-to-day running of this bustling base, this series monitors the work of those who dismantle and breathe new life into these mammoth machines. Here, the team members are faced with a tight deadline as they prepare to dismantle a highly anticipated Airbus A319 coming in from Abu Dhabi.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats get the lifeline they desperately need. Meanwhile, veteran prospector Col Duff prepares for a week-long opal hunt far from civilisation.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead drag a rare 1972 Datsun 510 2-door into the 21st century. The engine is in good order, but the bad paint job, gearbox and bodywork let it down.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John enjoy a tour of the Midlands. In Walsall, they have a money-spinning idea, in Birmingham Drew finds treasure and they also explore a grand country house.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Metal worker Dominic Chinea has to use all of his restoration skills to future proof an old, Cornish museum sign, while Steven Fletcher has to steer an old banger back onto the road. Plus, bear-care team Julie and Amanda start treatment on George, a very special teddy who has lost one of his eyes and his growl.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A barometer, rowing oars that could have a hidden past and a pinball machine that has spent the last few years being used as a kitchen worktop are restored.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Part one of two. Henry Cole climbs aboard his Harley Davidson Street Glide to brave the Friday night Sydney rush-hour traffic and head 520 miles to Melbourne.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats get the lifeline they desperately need. Meanwhile, veteran prospector Col Duff prepares for a week-long opal hunt far from civilisation.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: The pair reckon joining forces with a gang of traditional miners will help them strike gold, but as they get deeper into debt, relations with their mining partners become strained.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The work of investigators and scientists at the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms who are dedicated to preventing terrorism and reducing violent crime.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Black Hat
programme.desc: The murder of student Julissa Brisman, found shot and bound in a hotel room in Boston. Police used cameras to find her killer and were shocked by what they uncovered.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of self-made millionaire Buddy Parker's 26-year-old daughter Tara Swilley, who died after the carpet company owner's home was raked with gunfire by an embittered business associate in August 2004.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The investigation into an armed robbery in which masked gunmen tied up employees at an armoured-truck depot and fled with $18.9million.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: SPCA's cruelty investigators are called to an affluent suburb in the Houston area to rescue horses from a property. However, for some animals, help has come too late.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is desperate to save the life of a frail three-day old foal that has just been orphaned. Plus, Dr Lisa Chimes is trying to help a greedy cat that ate a 50cm ribbon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kristin wants to find a rock 'n' roll wedding dress, while Amber has two priorities - an outfit that is different and which shows off her tattoos.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.sub-title: No Dress, No Suit, No Venue, Oh My!
programme.desc: Kristen and Max have taken their chill lifestyle to the extreme. With only weeks until their wedding, there is no dress or venue in sight.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats Tigger the dog, who was hit by a car, Tim Faulkner makes a surprise discovery in one family's walls and a young boxer dog is struggling to walk.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and his team battle to save a puppy with broken ribs and internal bleeding, while Dr Baier attempts surgery he has never done before to treat a family's beloved rat.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Having spent the last two years in his bed due to his weight, Cillas' food addiction has hampered his relationship with his fiance and her three daughters.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of Ashley, who at 670 pounds is desperate to save her life and her marriage to husband David. She is also hopeful weight-loss surgery can give her the chance for a family of her own.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Mother-of-five Cynthia weighs 610 pounds and is physically unable to carry on her job as a special needs teacher. She resolves to lose weight for the sake of her career and her family.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Roxanne Paltauf, who vanished from a motel in Austin Texas in July 2006 after an argument with her boyfriend. After searching 10 acres for the 18-year-old's remains, police came up empty-handed.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Pageant queen Anastagia wants to choose her own dress, but first she needs to battle her mother's influence. Lisa clashes with her mum over an ivory gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Britanny shops with her uncle, who insists her dress has lots of sparkle, while Nicole finds her father is eager to please.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Triplet Samantha finds her opinionated sisters want to make the final dress decision, while siblings Jessica and Kristen shop together.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Rasha needs a ball gown that will wow all 700 guests at her wedding, while Melissa's father has a surprise for her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer knows what she wants from her dress, but her bridesmaids do not like the idea and push her into trying other styles.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride's mother has firm ideas about the wedding dress, while another does not approve of her daughter's desire for a sexy look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride wants a dress from her hometown that proves hard to obtain, while another customer takes a liking to a satin dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride tries on over 100 dresses in the search for the perfect look, while a woman getting married on a beach needs a gown that will cover her bare feet.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo suggests taking a family photo, but is met with resistance. She also helps a woman cope with her brother's death.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: The Caputos go on a double date with their friend Joe, who is sceptical of Theresa's psychic abilities.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo answers questions from fans who want to know more about her gift as a medium, and how spirits affect her life.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo shares never-before-seen footage of situations that have empowered people to connect with their loved ones.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Featuring a woman who has struggled to cope since killing her drug addict boyfriend in self-defence, and lives in an unsanitary state of chaos with her son.

programme.title: Evil Online
programme.desc: The case of a girl recovering from an abusive relationship, who sought love via a dating site and found a man who promised to protect her.

programme.title: Surviving Evil
programme.desc: A 2005 case from Texas, when a woman driver and her cousin were shot at by another road user. Jennifer Holliday's 18-year-old passenger was killed, while she almost lost her arm.

programme.title: Kid Criminals
programme.desc: Part two of two. In an effort to reduce the number of children in prison, some US states are trying a revolutionary new approach, with shorter sentences and an emphasis on rehabilitation and treatment programmes. Jason-Caleb Hill was caught breaking into an apartment and stealing a gun. He could be freed within six months if he completes his course. Amanda Artyamsoal was involved in a fatal arson attack that made national headlines. She hopes to be free by her 18th birthday in less than four weeks' time. Cyleina Briggs is spending some of her 10-year sentence at Madison Institutional Facility for girls, rather than an adult prison, while Nathaniel Johnson, 15, has taken 18 months to finish his course - three times longer than most inmates.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Gathering evidence from ashes and rubble to help forensics teams apprehend the perpetrators in cases of arson.
